scenario 1.background: Michael and Mark meet at a local coffee shop. Michael has recently started his own carpentry business and is aware that Mark has just bought a new house. Michael believes this could be a good opportunity to introduce his friend to his work.

dialogue.Michael: Hey Mark, it's been a while! I heard you moved into a new place. How's it coming along?
dialogue.Mark: Yeah, it's great but still needs some personal touches, you know?

dialogue.Michael: Absolutely, getting that personal touch can make all the difference. I've actually been working on some custom furniture pieces lately. The right piece can really tie a room together.

dialogue.Mark: That sounds interesting. Do you have any examples of your work?

dialogue.Michael: Sure, I can show you some photos. There are a few trends that might catch your eye.

scenario 2.background: Encouraged by Mark's interest, Michael decides to show him some of his recent projects on his phone. They are still at the coffee shop, sipping their drinks.

dialogue.Michael: Here are some of the pieces I've worked on. This one, in particular, has been a hit.
dialogue.Mark: Wow, these look amazing! You've really outdone yourself.

dialogue.Michael: Thanks, Mark! If you're interested, I could make something custom for your new home.

dialogue.Mark: I might just take you up on that. Let's talk details.

scenario 3.background: As they discuss the details, Michael notices Mark hesitating when the topic of cost comes up. Sensing his friend's concern, Michael decides to offer a discount.

dialogue.Michael: I can sense that the pricing might be a concern. How about I offer you a special 'friends and family' discount?

dialogue.Mark: That would be great, Michael. I appreciate it. It's just that the move has been quite expensive.

dialogue.Michael: I understand completely. Let's work something out that fits your budget.

scenario 4.background: After offering the discount, Michael feels that Mark might feel pressured into making a purchase. They have finished their coffee and are getting ready to leave.

dialogue.Michael: And hey, just so you know, there's absolutely no pressure to decide right now. I want you to be comfortable with any decision you make.

dialogue.Mark: Thanks, Michael. I appreciate that. It's good to know I can take my time.

dialogue.Michael: Of course! Let's just keep this conversation open, no rush.

scenario 5.background: Feeling relieved that Mark appreciates his understanding, Michael wants to ensure their friendship remains strong, regardless of whether a sale is made. They step outside the coffee shop.

dialogue.Michael: By the way, I'm organizing a community event next weekend. It's just a casual get-together. You should come by!

dialogue.Mark: That sounds like fun! I'd love to join. Thanks for the invite.

dialogue.Michael: Great! It'll be good to catch up more. See you then, Mark.
